item.title: More Canvas Problems
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“jimmy5410, post:6, topic:305066”]try:

ConstantPoolGen cpg = cg.getConstantPool(); int index = cpg.lookupUtf8(cg.getSuperclassName()); cpg.setConstant(index, new ConstantUtf8("Test"));
In which the String “Test” is whatever you are trying to change the superclass to.[/quote]this

the problem was occurring due to the fact that the superclass and the INVOKESPECIAL instruction were pointing to the same utf8 constant. since you only changed one, the other one still pointed to the java.awt.Canvas utf8. by directly modifying the constant they point to, both of them will be changed

Read full topic

item.title: More Canvas Problems
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

try:

ConstantPoolGen cpg = cg.getConstantPool(); int index = cpg.lookupUtf8(cg.getSuperclassName()); cpg.setConstant(index, new ConstantUtf8("Test"));
In which the String “Test” is whatever you are trying to change the superclass to.

Read full topic

item.title: More Canvas Problems
item.dc:creator: @Howso57 Howso57
item.description:
@Howso57 wrote:

This is my method for changing the super class

private void hackCanvas(String name) throws Exception { ClassGen cGen = new ClassGen(new ClassParser(dir + name + ".class") .parse()); cGen.setSuperclassNameIndex(cGen.getConstantPool().addClass( "com.Wrapper.CanvasWrapper")); cGen.getJavaClass().dump(dir + name + ".class"); }

Read full topic

item.title: More Canvas Problems
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

shangtsung1:

your CanvasWrapper doesnt seem too have a constructor of its own

Then his CanvasWrapper gets the default constructor.

Taharok:

It seems that the jo constructor may be trying to call Canvas’s constructor instead of CanvasWrapper’s instructor. You are probably going to have to modify the invokespecial call inside jo’s constructor to invoke the constructor of CanvasWrapper.

If he edited the constantPool entry for superClass name, he shouldn’t have this problem.

Show the code where you changed jo’s superclass.

Read full topic

item.title: More Canvas Problems
item.dc:creator: @Howso57 Howso57
item.description:
@Howso57 wrote:

Alright so I’ve been attempting to hack the canvas of runescape. I’ve searched around and been trying to follow this thread.

I am pretty sure I’ve gotten it all right except for the error that I get when loading the bot.

Canvas Class: jo Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.VerifyError: (class: jo, method: <init> signature: (Ljava/awt/Component;)V) Call to wrong initialization method at pp.b(Unknown Source) at pp.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

All that I’ve done is change the super class of jo to my own Canvas.

[code]public class CanvasWrapper extends Canvas {
public static BufferedImage show = new BufferedImage(Loader.width,
Loader.height, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB);
private BufferedImage meat = new BufferedImage(Loader.width, Loader.height,
BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB);

@Override
public final Graphics getGraphics() {
	final Graphics render = CanvasWrapper.show.getGraphics();
	render.drawImage(meat, 0, 0, null);
	render.drawString("I did it?", 10, 10);
	render.dispose();
	final Graphics g = super.getGraphics();
	g.drawImage(CanvasWrapper.show, 0, 0, null);
	return meat.getGraphics();
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
